title: Magnificent 7 Earnings Results Solidify Market Leadership

text: Investors bid the stock higher following the company's Q4 and full-year earnings announcement. Meta Platforms will pay its first-ever dividend in Q1.

title: Big Tech Crushes Earnings: Which One Should You Buy?
text: We saw a slew of earnings this week from the market's leading stocks, and they didn't disappoint. In addition to many other companies that reported earnings, five of the ‘Magnificent 7' informed us of their performance.

title: Meta's stock is the most overbought in 11 years, but that could be a good thing
text: There's a common belief that “overbought” is a technical condition for a stock, but in practice it seems to be more of an ability.

title: Facebook And Instagram Parent Meta Platforms Sets Stock Market Record, Adding $200B In Market Value In A Single Day
text: Facebook and Instagram parent company Meta Platforms set a stock market record Friday, adding $200 billion in market value in a single trading day on the heels of a knockout earnings report. The 20% rise in the tech giant's stock price, to an all-time high of $474.

text: The stock market is on track to notch new highs this week as stocks look to close well in the green Friday. So why are stocks up today?

title: 5 Investors Betting Big on Meta Platforms (META) Stock
text: Today's incredible move in Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) has taken the market by storm, with most major indices up alongside shares of the company. At the time of this writing, META stock is up more than 20%, buoyed by incredibly strong earnings and an announcement that the company will pay out its first-ever dividend to investors.

text: In Meta's latest annual filing, the company said CEO Mark Zuckerberg's involvement in "combat sports" and other activities is a risk to investors.

text: Meta Platforms blew past estimates in its fourth-quarter earnings report, with earnings per share tripling. The company initiated a dividend of $0.50 per share.

title: Move Over, FANG and Magnificent 7. Say Hello to the Next Big Portfolio: MnM.
text: While the so-called Magnificent 7 — an elite club of publicly traded enterprises — should remain powerfully relevant for the long haul, a focused approach could offer a superior solution. Enter “MnM” stocks, a new artificial intelligence-centric grouping that Raymond James analyst Josh Beck coined.

title: Meta Has Added $200B in Market Cap Friday. Let's Put That in Perspective
text: As of midday Friday, Meta (META) shares were up more than 20%, adding $208 billion to its market capitalization. If the firm can hold on to those gains, it will post the largest ever one-day jump in market value.

text: META shares spiked as much as 14% to a record high in aftermarket hours following its earnings results, pushing its market capitalization by $148 billion to $1.16 trillion.

title: Meta Platforms Stock Hits Record Highs After Earnings
text: Facebook-parent Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:META) announced profits that tripled in the fourth quarter, with earnings per share of $5.33 on revenue of $40.11 billion.

title: Why Meta's shiny new dividend and whopping $50 billion buyback plan may divide investors
text: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta declared its first dividend and another $50 billion in approved buybacks. The social-media giant may just be a cash cow, but it risks signaling its growth is slowing.

title: Tech Mania: Meta Stock Has Best Day In A Decade As Amazon Shares Hit 2-Year High
text: Shares of Meta and Amazon skyrocketed Friday to multiyear highs after the technology giants each reported blowout earnings, capping the firms' dramatic recoveries from their 2022 nadirs as some of their big tech stock peers have been relegated to the sidelines.

title: Meta Platforms: A Dividend Powerhouse In The Making
text: Meta Platforms, Inc. beat earnings estimates, raised guidance, and surprised investors with a dividend and buyback program. The company's dividend closely aligns with a prediction made in a previous article, indicating a commitment to rewarding shareholders. Meta Platforms has the financial ability to afford its current dividend and potentially increase it in the future, at least similar to Apple's dividend growth.

title: META Stock Alert: What to Know About Meta Platforms' First-Ever Dividend
text: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META ) stock is a hot topic among traders on Friday after the technology company that owns Facebook and Instagram announced its first-ever dividend. Meta Platform is kicking off its first dividend with a payment of 50 cents per share for holders of META stock.

title: Magnificent Meta Platforms stock will double in value
text: Meta Platforms NASDAQ: META still has a long way to go to double its valuation from the pre-Q4 release market cap, but it is on track to hit a $2 trillion valuation. The company's leaning into efficiency, its use of AI, and its loyal and growing fanbase continue to pay off for investors, and the story is only improving.

title: AI fever fuels ‘big market delusion' that could leave investors holding the bag
text: It's time for tech earnings — and that means a lot of talk about the future of artificial intelligence and all the money it will make companies and their investors in the years and decades to come.

title: Is it a bubble? Magnificent 7 market cap equals the GDP of 11 major cities
text: At $12.5 trillion — and likely a whole lot more after Friday — the combined market cap of Microsoft MSFT, +1.56%, Apple AAPL, +1.33%, Alphabet GOOGL, +0.76%, Amazon.com AMZN, +2.63%, Nvidia NVDA, +2.44% and Tesla TSLA, +0.84% is equal to the combined GDP of New, York, Tokyo, London, Los Angeles, Paris, Seoul, Chicago, San Francisco, Osaka, Dallas and Shanghai, according to Bank of America calculations.

title: Nasdaq to leap as Meta and Amazon fly ahead of jobs report
text: 7:00am: Nasdaq to leap as Meta and Amazon fly; Exxon and Chevron up after earnings  The Nasdaq is set to open sharply higher after gains in Meta and Amazon after the market close although the mood could be soured depending on the US jobs report. In pre-market trading, futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were up 0.1%, while those for the S&P 500 rose 0.5% and contracts for the Nasdaq 100 futures climbed 1.0%.

title: Meta shares surge 17% in premarket trade as investors cheer first-ever dividend
text: Meta shares surged about 17% in U.S. premarket trading on Friday, after the firm tripled profits in the fourth quarter and issued its first-ever cash dividend.

title: Meta just joined Nvidia and Microsoft in elite subset of the ‘Magnificent Seven'
text: That's the view of Raymond James analyst Josh Beck, who said that Meta's META, +1.19% latest results put it in an elite camp with Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +1.56% and Nvidia Corp. NVDA, +2.44% as Big Tech's leaders in the artificial-intelligence era.
